article.h1: Roll-over relief: reorganisations of constituencies: general

div.p: TCGA92/S264 provides for roll-over relief on capital gains realised from the disposal of land by a local constituency association of a political party where: where

ol.li: as a consequence of an order under Section 3, House of Commons (Redistribution of Seats) Act 1949, or under the Parliamentary Constituency Act 1986, the area of the Parliamentary constituency or constituencies covered by the local constituency association (the `existing association’) is changed;
some part of the area covered by the existing association becomes comprised in an area covered by another association (the `successor association’);
on or after 6 April 1983, the existing association either:-

div.p: i) disposes of land directly, or through an intermediate body, to a successor association,
ii) disposes of land which was used and occupied by it for the purposes of its functions and transfers the whole or part of the proceeds of the disposal to a successor association.

p.del: The provisions of Section 264 apply to disposals on or after 6 April 1983 in any case where the order referred to in CG61800(a) above comes into operation after 1 January 1983.

div.p: This relief is in addition to any roll-over relief available under TCGA92/S158(1)(e), see CG60260 Link: https://www.gov.uk/hmrc-internal-manuals/capital-gains-manual/cg60260 TCGA92/S158 (1)(e), see CG60270 Link: https://www.gov.uk/hmrc-internal-manuals/capital-gains-manual/cg60270 .
